materials.raw_text: Co: 128 g, Nb: 48 g, P: 35 g, Si: 60 g, Tm: 8 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a metal supply store or online (e.g. Sigma-Aldrich); Nb: Specialty metal suppliers; P: Chemical suppliers; Si: Semiconductor material suppliers; Tm: Rare earth metal suppliers.
steps: Co: Purchase from a metal supply store or online (e.g. Sigma-Aldrich); Nb: Specialty metal suppliers; P: Chemical suppliers; Si: Semiconductor material suppliers; Tm: Rare earth metal suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine Co, Nb, P, Si, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to ensure a uniform mixture for 10 minutes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient accurately using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine Co, Nb, P, Si, and Tm in the specified amounts. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to ensure a uniform mixture for 10 minutes.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1500°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a graphite crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1500°C. 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a graphite crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloy formation.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges to remove any sharp fragments and achieve a smooth finish.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges to remove any sharp fragments and achieve a smooth finish.
